meanings.definition: A substance or layer that underlies something, or on which some process occurs.
meanings.sent1: The soil acts as a substrate for the plants to grow in.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted on a wooden substrate to create a beautiful masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The substrate of the cake was so delicious that it disappeared quickly at the party.
meanings.sent4: The substrate of trust is essential for any successful relationship to thrive.
meanings.sent5: The substrate of the ocean floor is home to a diverse range of marine life.

meanings.definition: The surface or material on or from which an organism lives, grows, or obtains its nourishment.
meanings.sent1: The tree bark serves as a substrate for the moss to grow on.
meanings.sent2: The coral reef provides a substrate for various sea creatures to inhabit.
meanings.sent3: The substrate of the sandwich was so fresh that even the pickiest eater enjoyed it.
meanings.sent4: The substrate of the forest floor is like a bustling city for small insects.
meanings.sent5: The substrate of the plant pot was rich soil that helped the flower bloom beautifully.
